knimeNode.name: Anisotropic Diffusion
knimeNode.shortDescription: This Node applies the Perona and Malik diffusion scheme to denoise images.

fullDescription.intro:
This Node implements the so-called anisotropic diffusion scheme of Perona and Malik, 1990. For details on the anisotropic diffusion principles, see: http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Anisotropic_diffusion, and the original paper:
Perona and Malik. Scale-Space and Edge Detection Using Anisotropic Diffusion. IEEE Transactions on Pattern Analysis and Machine Intelligence (1990) vol. 12 pp. 629-639

tab.name: options
tab.option: This Option allows to use different Functions to be used for filtering. At the moment there are two Functions available: 1. STRONG_EDGE_ENHANCER can be used to enhance Edges and smooth everything in between 2. WIDE_REGION_ENHANCER doesn't preserve Edges but gives a very smooth image in total.

This parameter depends on the Function one uses. Usually a greater value means a stronger filtering, but this may result in more artifacts. It is recommended to use more Iterations to get a stronger filtering result instead of increasing Kappa.

This is the integration constant, typically less than 1. Usually a greater value means a stronger filtering, but this may result in more artifacts. It is recommended to use more Iterations to get a stronger filtering result instead of increasing Delta t.
This number says how often the Method is applied to the image, with the settings above. Be careful not to choose a value too large, this may slow down your calculations.
Says how many threads are used for calculation. For Expert use; the standard value should work fine.
